relation: go through the piles of to-hack stuff and move some of it to a staging place to go out

link this page to the touch screens and reverse engineering bar screen along with maintenance tasks such as sweeping and washing dishes
come up with an organizational scheme for the library
Debug ifstate failover. Verified working. Logging works.
Add an 802.11b/g AP to the West Wall
So we don't all die in a fire
So strangers that don't know don't damage the roof
So we don't all die in a fire

so we can see when we come in
so we can put stuff away better
Because the current UPS doesn't work right
so people who come into the space and don't necessarily read the wiki can get ideas on how to contribute
so people can find books, put them away and better decide which ones to get rid of
rtadvd advertises a ::/0 route that does nothing. This effectively blackholes all of the IPv6 internet
Increase coverage by front gate. Just because.
Collect trash about the space. Place it in the bins by the elevator. Take the trash out to the curb.
Build and print signs, put them up
finish the pipe runs, pull wires, hang and connect light fixtures
move stuff off the top shelves, install new top shelves
